Data visualization with R and ggplot2: from data to publication-quality graphics Part1 Welcome

Data visualization with R and ggplot2: from data to publication-quality graphics Sarah Bonnin 2023-09-09 Part1 Welcome Dates, time & location Dates: First edition: September 27-28 Second edition: October 19-20 Time: 9:30-13:30 Location: IDIBAPS Instructors Sarah Bonnin Prerequisites The workshop is open to anyone with no (or little) prior programming experience. Attendees must however feel comfortable enough with their own computer to install programs (and debug their installation if needed) and locate folders and files. Learning objectives Attendees will gain a high-level understanding of data import, manipulation and graphing with R and RStudio. They will be able to produce a variety of publication-quality graphs (among others: boxplots, histograms, dot plots, heatmaps). Learning outcomes Identify and use RStudio panels (console, scripts, folders and files panels). Locate useful resources to learn more and know where to seek help. Import data from files into R. Manipulate and prepare (filter, select) data. Produce graphs: Create a plot from “recipes”. Change parameters (color, font size, point shape, title, etc.). Export high-quality graphs in different formats (pdf, jpeg, png). Agenda Day 1: * 9:30-10:00 (30’): course introduction+ check the set up. * 10:00-10:45 (45’): introduction to R and Rstudio (Posit). * 10:45-11:30 (45’): import data / read files. * 11:30-12:00 (30’): break * 12:00-12:30 (30’): ggplot2: concept and structure. * 12:30-13:00 (30’:) guided boxplots, scatter plots, barplots, pie plots. * 13:00-13:30 (30’): exercises / changing graph parameters. Day 2: * 9:30-10:00 (30’): recall what was done on day 1 with a “warm up” exercise. * 10:00-10:45 (45’): introduction to simple data wrangling to filter and select data. * 10:45-11:30 (45’): exercises with filtering + graphs. * 11:30-12:00 (30’): break. * 12:00-12:30 (30’): introduction to interactive plotting with plotly. * 12:30-13:15 (45’): exercises combining what we learned so far. * 13:15-13:30 (15’): workshop wrap up.

2.2 Install R packages Once R and RStudio are successfully installed, Open RStudio: In the bottom-right panel, click on tab “Packages” and then “Install” . In the “Packages” box, write “tidyverse” and click “Install”. It should look like the below image: The installation of this first package will take several minutes. Repeat the process for the following packages: * ggrepel * pheatmap * VennDiagram * openxlsx Note: install packages one by one, as it eases debugging in case of installation failure. If installation of the first package (tidyverse) repeatedly fails, try and install the following packages independently: * tidyr * dplyr * ggplot2 * stringr

2.3 Check setup In order to make sure that the setup is successful, click again on tab “Packages” of the bottom-right panel, and tick packages that you just installed, like the “tidyverse package in that example: If no error (in red) appear in the console (bottom-left panel), installation should be ok. Check by copying and pasting the following line of code in the console (bottom-left panel) and click on Enter / Return. You should be able to see the scatter plot appear on the “Plots” tab in the bottom-right panel ! diamonds %>% dplyr::select(carat, price, clarity) %>% ggplot(aes(x=carat, y=price, col=clarity)) + geom_point()

Part5 Paths and directories The path of a file/directory is its location/address in the file system. 6.2 Simple calculations Given the following table: type of RNA Total mRNA 329 miRNA 45 snoRNA 12 lncRNA 28 Calculate the total number of RNAs reported in the table: 329 + 45 + 12 + 28 ## [1] 414 What is the percentage of miRNA? ( 45 / 414 ) * 100 ## [1] 10.86957

6.5 Assigning data to an object Assigning a value to the object B: B <- 10 Reassigning: modifying the content of an object: B + 10 B unchanged !! B <- B + 10 B changed !! You can see the objects you created in the upper right panel in RStudio: the environment.
